title: Issue #47 Manual Testing Procedure
content:
Manual testing procedure for Issue #47 Quick Tabs scenarios (automated testing not feasible in CI).

PREREQUISITES:
1. Build extension: npm run build:test
2. Load extension in browser (Chrome or Firefox)
3. Verify test bridge available (check console for TEST BRIDGE messages)

SCENARIOS TO VERIFY:

SCENARIO 1: Basic Creation & Cross-Tab Sync
- Create QT on page 1 â†’ Open new tab â†’ Verify QT appears at same position/size
- Expected: Instant sync via BroadcastChannel (<100ms latency)

SCENARIO 2: Multiple Quick Tabs
- Create 3 QTs on different pages â†’ Open new tab â†’ All 3 appear
- Expected: Global sync maintains all QT states

SCENARIO 3: Solo Mode (ðŸŽ¯)
- Create QT â†’ Click Solo button â†’ Switch to different site
- Expected: QT only visible on specific tab(s)

SCENARIO 4: Mute Mode (ðŸ”‡)
- Create QT â†’ On specific tab, click Mute â†’ Switch tabs
- Expected: QT hidden only on muted tab

SCENARIO 5: Manager Panel
- Create QT â†’ Ctrl+Alt+Z â†’ Minimize in Manager â†’ New tab
- Expected: QT remains minimized globally

SCENARIO 6: Cross-Tab Manager Sync
- Minimize QT â†’ New tab â†’ Open Manager â†’ Shows minimized
- Restore from Manager â†’ Switch tabs â†’ Restored everywhere

SCENARIO 7: Position/Size Persistence
- Move/resize QT â†’ Switch tabs â†’ Same position/size
- Reload page â†’ Still persists

SCENARIO 9: Close All Quick Tabs
- Create 3 QTs â†’ Manager â†’ Close All â†’ Switch tabs
- Expected: All QTs closed globally

VERIFICATION POINTS:
- Cross-tab sync latency (<100ms)
- Storage persistence (browser.storage.local)
- Container isolation (if using Firefox containers)
- Solo/Mute mutual exclusion
- Manager panel state accuracy

WHY MANUAL: Playwright extension tests hang indefinitely in CI (launchPersistentContext + Xvfb incompatibility). This is a known Playwright limitation, not a code issue.

TESTING FREQUENCY: Before each release or when Quick Tabs functionality changes.
